business.headline: US stock market: Wall Street dips amid Fed uncertainty and Trump-Putin talksAt the opening bell, the S&P 500 fell 54.92 points, or 0.97%, to 5,620.20, Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 206.06 points, or 0.49%, to 41,635.57, and the Nasdaq Composite decreased 295.45 points, or 1.66%, to 17,513.21.

RBI assures IndusInd Bank customers: 'Bank's financial health remains stable'The RBI has advised depositors and investors not to react to unverified reports regarding IndusInd Bank and instead trust official statements and regulatory updates.

Bengaluru man says Rs 1.5 lakh/month not enough: 'Everything is super inflated'In a recent social media post, a Bengaluru resident mentioned that despite earning a good income, he and his fiancée still live in PG accommodation, unable to afford a decent rental space in the city's expensive housing market.

Sensex settles 1,100 points higher, Nifty above 22,800; Zomato surges 7%Stock market closing today: The S&P BSE Sensex settled 1131.31 points higher at 75,301.26, while the NSE Nifty50 closed over 325.55 points higher to 22,834.30.

Zomato stock price zooms 6% today despite reports of insolvency pleaZomato stock price: Despite the insolvency plea, Zomato shares have not been impacted. They were trading 6.03% higher at Rs 216.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It had earlier reached an intraday high of Rs 216.50.

Online PF transfer claim rejected? How to apply againEPF claims can be turned down for multiple reasons. Hence, to avoid rejections, employees must carefully review and verify the details before submitting the claim form.

NPCI planning to stop 'collect calls'. Here's whyA collect call, or 'pull' transaction, allows merchants to initiate payment requests from customers. Still, fraudsters tend to exploit this mechanism for the purpose of deceiving others into paying for non-existent goods and services.

Explained: How India can shield itself from Donald Trump's tariff stormCan India escape the fallout of Trump's trade war, or will rising tariffs leave its economy exposed? Here is all you need to know.

Planning to buy land in Mumbai? See what $1 million gets youIn 2014, Rs 8 crore could get you 102 sq m of property in Mumbai, but in 2024, it bought only 99 sq m, according to Knight Frank's 'The Wealth Report'.

LIC hopes to decide on stake in health insurance company by March: ReportIf it enters the health space through a stake purchase, LIC will compete with the likes of Star Health Insurance, Aditya Birla Health Insurance, Niva Bupa Health Insurance and Care Health Insurance.

How EPF balance ensures financial security? 5 benefits to knowA sufficient EPF balance is a safety net in tough times. Though you cannot withdraw all the funds at any given point, you can partially withdraw them for certain needs such as a medical emergency, repayment of a home loan, higher studies, or to meet marriage expenses.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 14% today after hitting record lowOla Electric share price: The rise comes as investors seem to be buying the dip after yesterday's sharp fall. Trading volumes are higher today, supporting the stock's rebound.

LG Electronics India receives Sebi nod for IPO. Check key detailsThe IPO consists solely of an offer for sale (OFS) of up to 10.18 crore equity shares by parent company LG Electronics Inc. The face value of each share is Rs 10.
NMDC shares rise 2% after interim dividend announcement. Check detailsNMDC share price: At 11:15 am, NMDC share price was up 2% to Rs 66.26 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Paytm shares surge 6% as subsidiary gets Sebi's research analyst certificateAt around 10:58 am, Paytm shares were up 5.39% to Rs 725.95 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex jumps 1,000 points to rise above 75,000. What investors need to knowStock market rally today: The S&P BSE Sensex jumped nearly 1,000 points in afternoon trade, crossing the 75,100 mark, while the Nifty 50 shot past 22,750. At 2:54 pm, the Sensex was up 990.66 points to 75,160.61, and the Nifty had gained 288.55 points, trading at 22,797.30.

Gold prices at record high: Will it keep rising in near future?Investors are flocking to gold as escalating trade tensions, U.S. tariff measures, and global uncertainties boost demand for the safe-haven asset. With prices soaring to record levels, the key question remains: Will gold continue its upward trajectory in the near future?

Sensex surges 1,000 points. Why is the stock market rising today?Stock market rally: By 2:44 pm, the Sensex was up 980.77 points at 75,150.72, while the Nifty gained 284.95 points to trade at 22,793.70. Banking, auto, and financial stocks led the rally, pushing benchmark indices higher.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as banking stocks rally; ICICI, Zomato lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex initially rose above 400 points and was trading 326.28 points higher at 74,496.23 at around 9:22 am. The NSE Nifty 50 also gained 107.50 points to trade above 22,600.

Bajaj to buy out Allianz's stake in insurance joint ventures after 24 yearsThe two firms have had a joint venture in the insurance sector for 24 years, and the partnership will officially come to an end once the first tranche of at least 6.1% is acquired and Allianz is reclassified from a promoter to an investor.
Stock market opening on March 17: Will Sensex, Nifty continue positive run?Stock market opening prediction on March 17: Sensex and Nifty are expected to open today's session on a positive note.

Stocks to watch today: Bajaj Finserv, Tata Motors, Swiggy, IndusInd Bank, IREDAStocks to watch on March 18: Bajaj Finserv, Swiggy, IndusInd Bank, IREDA, and IRCON International are among the stocks likely to remain in focus today.

Looking for tax-saving options? Check out these 5 post office savings schemesAmong various tax-saving methods, post office savings schemes are considered one of the safest investment options since they are backed by the government.
Wall Street holds steadier following weeks of scary swingsThe S&P 500 was 0.1% higher after falling for four consecutive weeks amid Donald Trump's tariff threats to overseas markets.

'Stagflation' fears grow as US Fed prepares key interest rate decisionThe Federal Reserve faces rising inflation concerns and economic uncertainty ahead of its meeting. Potential stagflation complicates rate-cut plans, while higher tariffs and consumer inflation fears add pressure on policymakers and financial markets.

Wall Street witnesses modest gains as investors await Fed's rate decisionAt the opening bell, the S&P 500 increased 27.46 points, or 0.49%, to 5,666.40 and the Nasdaq Composite rose 59.43 points, or 0.33%, to 17,813.51. The Dow Jones Industrial Average climbed 203.34 points, or 0.50%, to 41,695.55.

Banking operations may be hit on March 24 and 25. Here's whyThe UFBU, a group representing nine major bank unions, announced the strike after failing to reach an agreement with the Indian Banks' Association (IBA).

Got credit card reward points? 4 ways to use themWhile most people use credit card reward points for shopping rewards, travel benefits, or cashback, they can also be used as a handy means to pay bills, including bill payments.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as healthcare and financial stocks boost marketThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 341.04 points to close at 74,169.95, while the NSE Nifty50 added 111.55 points to end at 22,508.75.

Ola Electric share price tanks over 7%: Should you buy, sell or hold?Ola Electric share price: The stock dropped to a record low of Rs 46.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) in early trade. By 3:00 pm, it was trading at Rs 46.95, down 7.10%.

New pension rules: Know how divorced and separated daughters can benefitThese changes aim to encourage women's participation in governance and administration and ensure financial independence for widows and separated women.

High Court clears Gautam Adani, brother in Rs 388 crore market violation caseThe case dates back to 2012 when the Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) filed a chargesheet against Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL) and its promoters, accusing them of criminal conspiracy and cheating.

Why financial investments make a better inheritance over antiques and businessFinancial investments like savings, stocks, bonds, and mutual funds are easy to inherit through a will or nomination. They can be easily transferred through a will or nomination, giving your children financial flexibility and immediate access to funds.
Who is Shark Tank India's new judge Srikanth Bolla? All you need to knowSrikanth Bolla will now be part of Shark Tank India's panel that evaluates and invests in promising business ideas.

Explained: Why MobiKwik shares fell 15% to hit 52-week low todayMobiKwik stock price: The sharp fall in its share price came after its three-month IPO lock-in expired. As a result, 6% of the company's outstanding stock or 46 lakh shares became eligible for trading.

Rosmerta Digital files insolvency plea against Ola Electric. All you need to knowOla Electric shares slipped below Rs 50 for the first time, hitting a record low of Rs 46.94 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Reliance Jio to offer free IPL streaming on recharge plans starting Rs 299Reliance Jio said customers who recharge for Rs 299 or more will continue to get free access to IPL matches through JioHotstar, the newly formed streaming service under the Reliance-Disney joint venture.
Citigroup plans to layoff 30% of IT contractors. Here's whyThis change is intended to enhance data security, improve risk management practices, and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

NPS pension processing now similar to OPS rules. Check latest guidelinesNew guidelines have been introduced to speed up the pension processing process and to ensure that retired employees receive their pensions on time without any trouble.
SIP and SWP are not the same. Here's how they differSIP (Systematic Investment Plan) is a way to invest money in mutual funds at regular intervals, helping investors build wealth over time.

entertainment.headline: Pakistani actor Danish Taimoor invokes internet's wrath for comments on polygamyPakistani actor Danish Taimoor's recent comments on Islam and polygamy have upset the internet. His controversial take on the concept of having multiple wives has been gathering heat on social media.

Exclusive: Lex Scott Davis on Suits LA, comparisons with original, Harvey's cameoIn Suits LA, Lex Scott Davis plays the role of Erica, a confident woman in a male-dominated world. In an interview with us, Davis teases about Harvey Specter's return to the Suits world.

Suits LA: Harvey Specter is here, but what does his entry bring to the table?Suits LA Episode 4: Harvey Specter has entered the show. However, he is still not on the West Coast yet. How will this new twist bring more excitement to Aaron Korsh's spin-off?

Dupahiya director Sonam Nair on heartland stories, comparison with PanchayatDupahiya director Sonam Nair opens up about the setting of the Prime Video show, comparisons with Panchayat and more in an exclusive interaction.

Kanneda star Parmish Verma on the 'incident' that turned his life upside downActor-singer Parmish Verma spoke to India Today about the time he got shot by a gangster. Verma mentioned how such incidents make you step back and look at your life in a new light.

Shekhar Kapur slams OTT for Bandit Queen's edits: No one asked meFilmmaker Shekhar Kapur recently criticised his film, Bandit Queen's OTT edits. Shekhar wrote about how Indian filmmakers are no less than Western directors.

Jeet Adani on joining Shark Tank India: Don't want to change just 1–2 livesJeet Adani will join Shark Tank India as a mentor for the Devang Special week, focusing on businesses by differently-abled entrepreneurs. He will be joined by the visually impaired entrepreneur Srikanth Bolla.

Pankaj Tripathi says he's 'proud' as daughter Aashi makes debut in music videoPankaj Tripathi's daughter Aashi debuts in the music video Rang Daaro. The music video left her parents emotional. Pankaj called it a proud moment as Aashi began her acting journey.

Rapper Hanumankind meets 'GOAT' Virat Kohli at RCB unbox event. See picRapper Hanumankind recently met Virat Kohli at the RCB unbox event at the Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. The rapper shared a picture from the special moment on social media.

Adolescence: Why everyone's talking about this mini-series on NetflixNetflix's Adolescence is earning rave reviews for its gripping one-shot storytelling and stellar performances. Critics and filmmakers like Hansal Mehta call it "next-level storytelling."

iHeartRadio Music Awards 2025: Taylor Swift dominates, Lady Gaga earns honourThe 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards celebrated top artistes, with Taylor Swift dominating the voted categories. Lady Gaga received a special honour, adding to the night's excitement.

Hania Aamir, Farhan Saeed's Mere Humsafar back on TV: When, where to watchThe popular Pakistani romance drama Mere Humsafar, starring Hania Aamir and Farhan Saeed, is making a comeback. Find out when and where you can watch this beloved series.

Alka Yagnik reacts to Osama bin Laden being her fan: Is it my fault?Alka Yagnik's old interview reacting to Osama bin Laden being her fan has resurfaced. She also spoke about industry politics, revealing how she lost songs to senior singers. Her remarks are now viral.

Former Punjab Chief Minister attends Sidhu Moosewala's brother's 1st birthday bashFormer Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi visited Sidhu Moosewala's home to celebrate the first birthday of the late singer's brother, Shubhdeep. The event, held at Musa village, saw Channi participating in the cake-cutting ceremony.

Malaika Arora scolds contestant for inappropriate danceActor Malaika Arora recently scolded a 16-year-old contestant for his inappropriate dance moves. Malaika asked for the contestant's mother's number.

Hina Khan emotional as boyfriend Rocky calls her a 'brave soul' amid cancer battleActor Hina Khan's boyfriend Rocky Jaiswal recently appeared on Celebrity MasterChef. Rocky spoke about Hina;s cancer battle and called her a 'braveheart.'

Salman Khan's nephew Ayaan on stage name Agni and fighting the nepotism tagBollywood superstar Salman Khan's nephew, Ayaan Agnihotri, recently made his music debut. In an exclusive conversation with India Today Digital, the actor opened up about his stage name and battling the nepotism tag.

Exclusive: Tayme on The White Lotus S3, Lisa of Blackpink, Asian representationTayme Thapthimthong's journey from a real-life security guard to a celebrated actor in The White Lotus Season 3 is truly remarkable. Paired with Blackpink's Lisa, Tayme, in an exclusive chat with India Today speaks about his journey, Asian representation and more.

Kim Kardashian vs Kanye West: Rapper fights with ex-wife over daughter's nameKanye West released a song featuring daughter North, despite Kim Kardashian's objections. She took legal action, but Kanye leaked their private chat and refused to back down, escalating their feud.

general news.headline: Trump, Putin discuss Russia-Ukraine war, call still underway after 2 hoursPresident Donald Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin from the Oval Office at 10:00 AM ET. The two leaders discussed the war in Ukraine and potential peace efforts and ceasefire.

45 solo Dubai trips, multiple business ventures: Probe deepens in Ranya Rao caseKannada actor Ranya Rao's arrest in a gold smuggling case has led to a major probe into her financial dealings, alleged hawala transactions, and a widening investigation involving multiple accused.

How Sunita Williams's 8-day flight turned into a nine-month struggleShortly after they arrived at the ISS, engineers discovered several critical issues with the spacecraft, including helium leaks and propulsion system malfunctions.

After Virat Kohli's criticism, BCCI may rethink family stay policy: SourcesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India may consider relaxing the rules on families accompanying players during overseas tours. The development comes days after Virat Kohli expressed his disappointment with the current policy.

Can gentle parenting ever go mainstream in India?In India, parenting is often seen as synonymous with discipline, limits, and the occasional 'flying chappal'. But can gentle parenting find its place here?
Congress appoints Rajesh Kumar as Bihar unit chief ahead of pollsCongress appoints Rajesh Kumar as Bihar unit chief ahead of polls

Vacate Indian territory: Government blasts Pak for remarks on J&K after PM podcastHitting back at Pakistan for its criticism of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's remarks on Pakistan thwarting New Delhi's peace overtures in a podcast with Lex Fridman, India asked Islamabad to vacate Indian territory under its illegal and forcible occupation.

Aurangzeb's tomb isn't in Delhi or Nagpur, but in little-known Khuldabad. Why?A curfew had to be imposed in some areas of Nagpur after protests over Aurangzeb's tomb turned violent. The 17th-century emperor's final resting place isn't in Delhi, the seat of Mughal power, or Ahmednagar, where he died, but in the lesser-known Khuldabad in Maharasthra. Here's why.

Aamir, Gauri Spratt clicked together for 1st time after confirming relationshipActor Aamir Khan and his live-in partner, Gauri Spratt were clicked together in Mumbai for the first time after confirming their relationship. A video of them together has gone viral.

Scientists in Antarctica send SOS, report sexual assault, death threats by colleagueScientists at South Africa's Antarctica base sent an email, alleging assault, sexual assault, and death threats from a colleague.

Telangana's 42% quota push based on caste census, a first for any stateTelangana Assembly passed a bill to increase Backward Classes (BC) reservations from 23 per cent to 42 per cent. The move takes total reservations in the state beyond 50 per cent cap, likely triggering legal scrutiny.

PM's message to 'India's daughter' Sunita Williams: Miles away, yet close to heartsSunita Williams expressed her gratitude for the Prime Minister's thoughtful gesture and the support from India during her time in space.

IPL 2025 Preview: Pat Cummins-led SRH aim to prove 2024 dominance was no flukeSunRisers Hyderabad's ultra-aggressive approach paid off in 2024 as the team reached their first playoffs since the 2020 season. In 2025, SRH's main goal will be to prove that their exploits in the previous season were not a fluke.

Pakistan army's gym rat problemFacing dozens of attacks in restive areas and protests online and offline, Pakistan's once-powerful military seems to have lost the plot and its grip. The Pakistani army's problems are typical of gym rats. This is why the Pakistani military is stuck in a political quicksand as its morale is low.

Hamas's head of government in Gaza, top officials killed in Israeli strikesThe latest escalation shattered a two-month ceasefire, with Israeli forces ramping up military operations against Hamas and Netanyahu saying that they will use force to free remaining hostages.

What are the signals from Abhishek Banerjee's 'comeback' meetThe virtual gathering helmed by the TMC leader focused on revamping the party organisation and a head start on checking alleged electoral manipulation by its main rival.

Fadnavis calls Nagpur violence 'well-planned attack', Opposition blames governmentThe Opposition attacked the state government over the law and order situation after clashes broke out in Nagpur. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and BJP leaders termed the incident a planned attack.

Beyond BEd: How important are teacher training exams for quality education?As the education system in India evolves along with its curriculum and structure, the necessity of teacher qualifications and training becomes a concerning issue.
Looking for an affordable SUV? Here are 5 options under Rs 10 lakhThe Tata Punch, Hyundai Exter, Maruti Suzuki Fronx, Skoda Kylaq, and Kia Syros are available for under Rs 10 lakh (ex-showroom).
Supreme Court seeks Centre's reply on plea against Arunachal Chief MinisterThe petitioner alleged that many contracts were given to a company owned by Arunachal Chief Minister Pema Khandu's wife.

Kim Soo-hyun releases new statement on Kim Sae-ron row, denies any wrongdoingKorean star Kim Soo-hyun's team has released a new statement amid the ongoing controversy regarding his alleged involvement in actor Kim Sae-ron's death.

BCCI Apex Council to discuss government directive on tobacco ads before IPL openerThe Indian cricket board's Apex Council will meet on Saturday, hours before the IPL 2025 opener in Kolkata. The agenda includes discussions on Women's World Cup venues, the structure of domestic cricket, and the Health Ministry's latest directive on restricting tobacco and alcohol advertisements.

Premier League backs Wesley Fofana after racial abuse following London derbyThe Premier League has backed Wesley Fofana after the Chelsea defender was subjected to racial abuse following the London derby loss to Arsenal. The Kiwis comfortably chased down the target of 136 riding on splendid knocks from Tim Siefert and Finn Allen.

Shaheen trolled as Seifert hits him for 4 sixes in an over: Overrated fraudShaheen Shah Afridi was massively trolled on social media as the Pakistan pacer was destroyed by Tim Seifert during the 2nd T20I. Seifert hit Shaheen for 4 sixes in an over as the pacer went wicketless on Tuesday.

IPL 2025: How does revamped player replacement rule work ahead of new season?With 4 replacements happening before the start of the new season, we have a look at the revamped rules for IPL 2025 in which a team can replace an unavailable member of their roster with a new player.

Watch: Mayank Yadav starts bowling at BCCI Centre of Excellence ahead of IPL 2025Lucknow Super Giants fast bowler Mayank Yadav has started bowling at the BCCI Centre of Excellence ahead of Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). Mayank has been undergoing rehabilitation since November 2024.

India are not good in Tests, Rohit Sharma should take responsibility: Sourav GangulyFormer India cricketer Sourav Ganguly has said that captain Rohit Sharma should take responsibility of turning things around in Test cricket. India haven't had a good run in Test cricket in recent times.

Honoured to captain KKR, ready for the challenge that lies ahead: Ajinkya RahaneKolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) new captain Ajinkya Rahane said that it's an honour for him to lead the team in Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) and mentioned that he's ready for the challenge to defend the title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
